hasDefinedTerm.name: Average Order Value
hasDefinedTerm.description: The average dollar amount every single customer spends when they place an order, calculated by dividing total revenue by total number of orders

hasDefinedTerm.name: Ecommerce Optimization
hasDefinedTerm.description: The process of improving online store performance to increase sales, conversion rates, and customer satisfaction

hasDefinedTerm.name: Shopify Marketing Strategies
hasDefinedTerm.description: Specific tactics and methods used on the Shopify platform to increase sales and customer engagement

hasDefinedTerm.name: Product Bundling
hasDefinedTerm.description: Grouping related items into a kit or pack for a slight discount to increase cart value

hasDefinedTerm.name: Volume Discounts
hasDefinedTerm.description: Pricing strategy offering increasing discounts based on quantity purchased

hasDefinedTerm.name: Free Shipping Threshold
hasDefinedTerm.description: A minimum purchase amount required to qualify for free shipping, designed to increase order value

hasDefinedTerm.name: Upselling
hasDefinedTerm.description: Sales technique of convincing customers to buy a more expensive version of a product they're considering

hasDefinedTerm.name: Cross-selling
hasDefinedTerm.description: Sales technique of suggesting complementary items to customers, like offering fries with a burger

hasDefinedTerm.name: Customer Lifetime Value
hasDefinedTerm.description: The total revenue a business can expect from a single customer throughout their relationship

hasDefinedTerm.name: Return on Ad Spend
hasDefinedTerm.description: A marketing metric that measures the revenue generated for every dollar spent on advertising

@graph.name: How to Calculate Average Order Value (AOV)
@graph.description: Step-by-step guide to calculating your store's Average Order Value

step.name: Gather Revenue Data
step.text: Collect your total revenue for a specific period (like a month)

step.name: Count Total Orders
step.text: Count the total number of orders you received in that same time period

step.name: Apply the Formula
step.text: Divide Total Revenue by Total Number of Orders to get your AOV

step.name: Example Calculation
step.text: If you made $50,000 from 1,000 orders, your AOV is $50,000 รท 1,000 = $50

mainEntity.name: Beyond a simple discount, what pricing strategy rewards customers for larger orders?

acceptedAnswer.text: A tiered pricing strategy is an effective approach. For example, offer increasing discount percentages or exclusive rewards as the customer's order value grows. This tactic encourages shoppers to add more items to achieve a better deal, directly improving results.

mainEntity.name: How can customer data and metrics inform effective AOV offers on Shopify?

acceptedAnswer.text: Use customer purchase data on your Shopify store to create personalized offers. Analyzing metrics helps identify products people frequently buy together, providing a data-driven choice for creating bundles or upsell strategies that resonate with specific buyers.

mainEntity.name: Which approach is better for consumers: a minimum order discount or product bundling strategies?

acceptedAnswer.text: While a discount is a good tactic, bundling strategies often provide more perceived value to consumers. This approach gives buyers a curated choice and a simple way to get more, often leading to better results than a simple minimum order goal.
